greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1)=1 and, for n>1, a(n)=a(n-1)+n if n is even and a(n)=smallest positive integer which has not yet appeared in the sequence if n is odd.
comment: A001951 and A001952 are the bisections of this sequence. - _Klaus Brockhaus_ and _Henry Bottomley_, Feb 04 2006. This implies the asymptotic result stated in the formula line.
formula: For even n, the ratio a(n)/a(n-1) is asymptotic to 1+sqrt(2) as n becomes large.
results.author: _John W. Layman_, Apr 29 2004
